intro: Chenopodium rubrum var. diffusum, commonly known as red goosefoot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a reddish or purplish tint, and it produces small, greenish flowers in compact clusters. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. This plant is also known for its edible leaves, which are rich in nutrients and used in various traditional cuisines.
